cards.name: Full Heal Energy
text: If you play this card from your hand, the Pokémon you attach it to is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. Full Heal Energy Provides energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Potion Energy
text: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any. Potion Energy provides energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Pokémon Breeder
text: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

cards.name: The Boss's Way
text: Search your deck for an Evolution card with Dark in its name. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Challenge!
text: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Energy Trans
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mirror Shell
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Dark Wartortle during your opponent's next turn (even if Dark Wartortle is Knocked Out), Dark Wartortle attacks the Defending Pokémon for an equal amount of damage.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Defender is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Does 30 damage times number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card to use this attack.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Confused.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

ability.name: Strikes Back
ability.text: Whenever opponent damages Machamp (even if it knocks out Machamp), this power does 10 damage to attacker (no weakness or resistance.) This power cannot be used if Machamp is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when opponent attacks.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: (20x) Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: (?) Does damage to defender equal to half the defender's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Pokémon Trader
text: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

cards.name: Potion
text: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

ability.name: Energy Burn
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into R for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Surprise Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coin is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon

ability.name: Toxic Gas
ability.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Curse
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own).

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: (20x) Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: (30x) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

ability.name: Kabuto Armor
ability.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack only does half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

ability.name: Transparency
ability.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: (20x) Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: (10x) Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran M or Nidoran F and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: After damage dealing, opponent chooses 1 Benched Pokémon and switches it with defending Pokémon (only if opponent has Benched Pokémon).

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
text: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play. (Major text change in Legend Maker. Requires reference.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on defender.

ability.name: Thick Skinned
ability.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Retreat Aid
ability.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay 1 Energy less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: (10+) Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Anger
attacks.text: (20+) Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Clairvoyance
ability.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Tail Wag
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Eevee during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

ability.name: Evolutionary Light
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: (20+) Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during opponent's next turn. (any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: (50-) Does 50 damage minus 10 for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to self.

ability.name: Damage Swap
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from one of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't K-O that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Confused.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each W Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Fascinate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Reel In
ability.text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Flareon in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card to use this attack.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to self.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards to use this attack.

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; If tails, this attack does 30 damage plus Nidoking does 10 damage to self.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: Defender is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches the Defending Pokémon with it. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times number of damage counters on Magikarp.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod on opponent's next turn. (any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, defender is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: (30x) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: (20+) Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the defender is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Long Distance Hypnosis
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may flip a coin. If heads defender is now Asleep; if tails, your active Pokémon is now Asleep. The power can't be used if Drowzee is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Defender is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: (10x) Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During opponent's next turn, prevent 30 or less damage (after applying weakness and resistance). (any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Dizziness
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more for each Energy attaches to Psyduck but not used to pay for this attack's energy cost. You can add more then 20 damage this way.

attacks.name: Sand
attacks.text: If defender tries to attack during opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Scoop Up
text: Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

ability.name: Summon Minions
ability.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10).
